dt: {bc}one whose native language is German and who is a native of a country other than Germany
{bc}the Germanic language spoken mainly in Germany, Austria, and parts of Switzerland
{bc}the literary and official language of Germany

{bc}a dance consisting of intricate figures that are improvised and intermingled with waltzes
{bc}one at which the german is danced

et: Middle English, from Medieval Latin {it}Germanus{/it}, from Latin
shortdef: a native or inhabitant of Germany
one whose native language is German and who is a native of a country other than Germany

dt: {bc}of, relating to, or characteristic of {d_link|Germany|Germany:g}, the Germans, or German

dt: {bc}having the same parents or the same grandparents on either the maternal or paternal side
usually used after the noun which it modifies and joined to it by a hyphen

et: Middle English {it}germain{/it}, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}germanus{/it} having the same parents, from {it}germen{/it}
shortdef: having the same parents or the same grandparents on either the maternal or paternal side —usually used after the noun which it modifies and joined to it by a hyphen

dt: {bc}a small active winged cockroach ({it}Blattella germanica{/it}) probably of African origin that is a common household pest in the U.S.

shortdef: a small active winged cockroach (Blattella germanica) probably of African origin that is a common household pest in the U.S. —called also Croton bug

fl: noun, plural in form but singular or plural in construction

dt: {bc}an acute contagious virus disease that is caused by a togavirus (species {it}Rubella virus{/it} of the genus {it}Rubivirus{/it}) and is milder than typical measles but is damaging to the fetus when occurring early in pregnancy

shortdef: an acute contagious virus disease that is caused by a togavirus (species Rubella virus of the genus Rubivirus) and is milder than typical measles but is damaging to the fetus when occurring early in pregnancy —called also rubella

dt: {bc}any of a breed of working dogs of German origin that are intelligent and responsive and are often used in police work and as guide dogs for the blind

shortdef: any of a breed of working dogs of German origin that are intelligent and responsive and are often used in police work and as guide dogs for the blind —called also Alsatian

dt: {bc}any of a breed of gundogs of German origin that have a liver or liver and white short coat

shortdef: a silver-white alloy of copper, zinc, and nickel
